summary: George Edward Wright is identified as a Black Panther member who traveled from Algiers to Paris in 1973. While in Paris, he and other Black Panther members were reportedly receiving support from Henri Curiel's organization to obtain plastic surgery and false documentation for re-entry into the U.S. The CIA requested photos to aid in their identification. He is mentioned in the context of information about American Black militants/hijackers and their movements, as well as reports on the Black Panther Party in Algiers.
significance: The documents do not indicate any connection to the JFK assassination. George Edward Wright is mentioned in the context of Black Panther Party activities, potential hijacking, and efforts to obtain false documentation for re-entry into the U.S.
